text: Kibatalia borneensis is a species of plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is endemic to the state of Sarawak, part of Malaysia on the island of Borneo.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant Families It is threatened by habitat loss.World Conservation Monitoring Centre 1998. Kibatalia borneensis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007. ==References== borneensis Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Flora of Sarawak Category:Endangered plants Category:Plants described in 1901 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Elmer Drew Merrill
title: Kibatalia borneensis
